parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The account id of a user.

parameters.name: usernames
parameters.description: The account username of a user.

parameters.name: facebook_ids
parameters.description: The Facebook ID of a user.

name.description: A unique name for the group.

lang_tag.description: The language expected to be a tag which follows the BCP-47 spec.

metadata.description: Additional information stored as a JSON object.

avatar_url.description: A URL for an avatar image.

private.description: Mark a group as private where only admins can accept members.

email.description: The email address of the user.

devices.description: The devices which belong to the user's account.

custom_id.description: The custom id in the user's account.

verify_time.description: The UNIX time when the user's email was verified.

apiAccount.description: A user with additional account details. Always the current user.

apiAccountCustom.description: Send a custom ID to the server. Used with authenticate/link/unlink.

id.description: A device identifier. Should be obtained by a platform-specific device API.

apiAccountDevice.description: Send a device to the server. Used with authenticate/link/unlink and user.

password.description: A password for the user account.

apiAccountEmail.description: Send an email with password to the server. Used with authenticate/link/unlink.

token.description: The OAuth token received from Facebook to access their profile API.

apiAccountFacebook.description: Send a Facebook token to the server. Used with authenticate/link/unlink.

timestamp_seconds.description: Time since UNIX epoch when the signature was created.

salt.description: A random "NSString" used to compute the hash and keep it randomized.

public_key_url.description: The URL for the public encryption key.

apiAccountGameCenter.description: Send Apple's Game Center account credentials to the server. Used with authenticate/link/unlink.

token.description: The OAuth token received from Google to access their profile API.

apiAccountGoogle.description: Send a Google token to the server. Used with authenticate/link/unlink.

token.description: The account token received from Steam to access their profile API.

apiAccountSteam.description: Send a Steam token to the server. Used with authenticate/link/unlink.

collection.description: The collection which stores the object.

key.description: The key of the object within the collection.

version.description: The version hash of the object.

apiFriends.description: A collection of zero or more friends of the user.

creator_id.description: The id of the user who created the group.

name.description: The unique name of the group.

lang_tag.description: The language expected to be a tag which follows the BCP-47 spec.

metadata.description: Additional information stored as a JSON object.

avatar_url.description: A URL for an avatar image.

private.description: Mark a group as private where only admins can accept members.

count.description: The current count of all members in the group.

create_time.description: The UNIX time when the group was created.

update_time.description: The UNIX time when the group was last updated.

apiGroups.description: A collection of zero or more groups.

match_id.description: The ID of the match, can be used to join.

authoritative.description: True if it's an server-managed authoritative match, false otherwise.

size.description: Current number of users in the match.

matches.description: A number of matches corresponding to a list operation.

content.description: Content of the notification in JSON.

sender_id.description: ID of the sender, if a user. Otherwise 'null'.

create_time.description: The UNIX time when the notification was created.

persistent.description: True if this notification was persisted to the database.

cacheable_cursor.description: Use this cursor to paginate notifications. Cache this to catch up to new notifications.

apiNotificationList.description: A collection of zero or more notifications.

collection.description: The collection which stores the object.

key.description: The key of the object within the collection.

user_id.description: The user owner of the object.

payload.description: The payload of the function which must be a JSON object.

http_key.description: The authentication key used when executed as a non-client HTTP request.

apiRpc.description: Execute an Lua function on the server.

created.description: True if the corresponding account was just created, false otherwise.

apiSession.description: A user's session used to authenticate messages.

collection.description: The collection which stores the object.

key.description: The key of the object within the collection.

user_id.description: The user owner of the object.

version.description: The version hash of the object.

permission_write.description: The write access permissions for the object.

create_time.description: The UNIX time when the object was created.

update_time.description: The UNIX time when the object was last updated.

username.description: The username of the user's account.

display_name.description: The display name of the user.

avatar_url.description: A URL for an avatar image.

location.description: The location set by the user.

timezone.description: The timezone set by the user.

apiWriteStorageObjectsRequest.description: Write objects to the storage engine.

protobufBoolValue.description:
Wrapper message for `bool`.

The JSON representation for `BoolValue` is JSON `true` and `false`.

protobufEmpty.title:
A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated
empty messages in your APIs. A typical example is to use it as the request
or the response type of an API method. For instance:

protobufInt32Value.description:
Wrapper message for `int32`.

The JSON representation for `Int32Value` is JSON number.

protobufStringValue.description:
Wrapper message for `string`.

The JSON representation for `StringValue` is JSON string.
